channel.title: Ubuntu on Slightly Ahead of Behind the Curve
channel.description: Recent content in Ubuntu on Slightly Ahead of Behind the Curve

item.title: One Unity Launcher
item.description: T’was decided that the default behavior for Unity’s launcher will be to appear only on the primary monitor in Ubuntu 12.04. For some reason, when I upgraded to 12.04 (beta) today, my setting was for the launcher to appear on ALL desktops. Not a fan of it on all desktops. For those who want to change this setting, you’ll need to install the Compiz configuration manager. > sudo aptitude install compizconfig-settings-manager Once installed, run it.
